title: Hong Kong’s Bankless Leader Reveals the Long Arm of the U.S. Treasury
sub_head: International lenders fear secondary sanctions; here’s why
body:
After being sanctioned by the U.S. in August, Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam says she can’t get a bank account in her own city, according to an interview with TV station HKIBC that aired Friday.
The message from Mrs. Lam’s statement is that Hong Kong and Chinese banks are unable to provide services for her because the risk of what the U.S. government could do in retaliation is too great. And there is good reason to think that is true.
